titleStmt.title: A wonderful prophesie declared by Christian James; a maid of twenty two years of age, (late daughter to Dan. James) ... who departed this life upon the 8. of Mar. With the true relation of her behaviour, both in her life time, and at the hour of her death, worthy to be had in memory. The tune is, In summer time.
titleStmt.author: L. P. (Laurence Price), fl. 1625-1680?

titleStmt.title: A wonderful prophesie declared by Christian James; a maid of twenty two years of age, (late daughter to Dan. James) ... who departed this life upon the 8. of Mar. With the true relation of her behaviour, both in her life time, and at the hour of her death, worthy to be had in memory. The tune is, In summer time.
titleStmt.author: L. P. (Laurence Price), fl. 1625-1680?

notesStmt.note: Date of publication from Wing (2nd ed.)
"Contrived into meeter, by L.P." Attributed to Laurence Price by Wing (2nd ed.)
Includes at end: "The Names of the Masters of the Parish that saw the Maid on her death-bed and heard the words of the Prophesie..."
Reproduction of original in: University of Glasgow. Library.
